steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"85t2s","text":"Disinfect the surgical area.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"207fo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2rkgd","text":"Spray area for the surgical drape with PREempt and let sit for at least  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":72,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5pd2k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9l7r7","text":"Spray all other surfaces - surgical rig, induction chamber, station tools, knobs buttons, and switches you touch during the procedure with 70% Ethanol reapplying after 5 min, so you have a minimum contact time of  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":213,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1pd9s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ea77n","text":"Using a non-sterile Kimwipe wipe up any residual PREempt and 70% Ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"27eqb","text":"Cover heating pad on surgical rig with a layer of press ‘n’ seal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"57dkp","text":"Prepare the surgical drape with supplies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"40jk4","text":"Open a fresh sterile drape, touching only the blue side to ensure sterility, place it white side up and blue side down, on the area disinfected with PREempt.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cmoh9","text":"Open sterile packages surgical supplies (Cotton swabs, kimwipes, gauze, and sugi absorbent spears), pouring the items onto the surgical drape to preserve sterility.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4jup1","text":"Fill a 10mL or 20mL syringe with ACSF (Artificial Cerebrospinal Fluid), then attach 0.2um syringe filter and 25G 5/8” needle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"74l77","text":"Prepare peri-operative drugs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i90f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkidf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"coj23","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9lqta","text":"Drugs should only be administered in accordance with IACUC and veterinary requirements. Ensure timing, dosage, and route of administration are accounted for. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"19gc1","text":"Remove autoclaved surgery tools from the sterilization tray and place on the sterile drape, taking care to not touch the instrument tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"58jfe","text":"Obtain titanium headpost with associated well, spray with 70% ethanol and place on drape with the side that will interface with the skull up. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ao8s","text":"Prepare additional 0.3ml insulin syringe for vetbond application.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3magv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oequ","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"72ll0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ao3il","text":"Do not fill syringe until use as it may become clogged.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Prepare Surgical Station for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f8eem","text":"Obtain #10 Scalpel blade for skin incision.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Anesthesia System and Anesthetize the Mouse (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"v8rd","text":"Ensure that all tubes are connected securely and that you can feel the vacuum suction in the scoop underneath the nose cone. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8e30f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Anesthesia System and Anesthetize the Mouse (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"62qh3","text":"Ensure the Isoflurane line to the induction chamber is open and the line to the nose cone is closed via their designated stopcocks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Anesthesia System and Anesthetize the Mouse (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fvbkg","text":"Remove the animal from its experimental cage, obtain a preoperative weight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Anesthesia System and Anesthetize the Mouse (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9al7a","text":"Place the mouse into the induction chamber, open the vacuum valve (stopcock) and isoflurane line (stopcock) for the chamber, and then turn on the isoflurane vaporizer to 5%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Anesthesia System and Anesthetize the Mouse (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d859g","text":"Once the mouse is fully unconscious, turn off the isoflurane and wait at least 10 seconds with the vacuum on to allow the chamber to clear before removing the animal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Anesthesia System and Anesthetize the Mouse (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cdfpm","text":"Position mouse on surgical rig by placing maxillary incisors in the hole on the bite bar and securing head with ear bars.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Anesthesia System and Anesthetize the Mouse (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6mk0j","text":"Secure the nose cone over the mouse’s snout. Make sure the body of the mouse is on top of the heading pad, resting comfortably. Redirect the gas flow from the induction chamber to the surgical rig via line stopcocks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kq5d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47dgd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"de00e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D56146052F3A11EFA42B0A58A9FEAC02","height":492,"id":478101,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"3fgv6\",\"text\":\"Illustration of mouse fixed to sterotax via ear bars and bite bar.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Surgical_Mice_NEW_01.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qu5ab7ni7.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qu6xb7ni7.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qu6wb7ni7.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Prepare the Anesthesia System and Anesthetize the Mouse (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3vqpn","text":"Set the isoflurane to ~1.5-2%, turn off the vacuum line to the induction chamber and close the lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Anesthesia System and Anesthetize the Mouse (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2jdv6","text":"Monitor the mouse’s breathing throughout the process and adjust gas levels as necessary. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Mouse for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a1f35","text":"Apply Systane to the end of a cotton swab and use to push the whiskers away from the surgical field. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Mouse for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"51esr","text":"Cover the mouse’s eyes with a generous amount of Systane. Additional Systane should be added as needed to prevent eye dryness and protection from the scope light. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Mouse for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"50l65","text":"Administer any drugs that have a timing after induction or prior to incision.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Mouse for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ett2s","text":"Use black handled scissors to shorten fur from top of the head. Use caution when trimming hair around the eyes. Avoid cutting off whiskers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69loa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6poev","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1lssg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c49bm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d52ct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6ck8v","text":"Hair removal is contingent on the type of surgery and placement of headframe, optic fibers, etc.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Prepare the Mouse for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ec631","text":"Apply Nair with the pointed end of a non-sterile cotton swab, gently swirling it down to the interface of the skin and hair.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Prepare the Mouse for Surgery (all procedures)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ue56","text":"Remove all Nair with several alcohol swabs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7i6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8o1u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b67qk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"158EC35B2F3B11EFA42B0A58A9FEAC02","height":512,"id":478103,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"eli3j\",\"text\":\"Illustration of mouse with the fur on top of head removed.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"45u\",\"text\":\"Note: Systane not illustrated.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Surgical_Mice_NEW_02.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qu5cb7ni7.png","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qu6zb7ni7.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qu6yb7ni7.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bu4fe","text":"Once the pipette is secured to the collet, press, and hold the ‘EMPTY’ button on the control box until an audible beep is heard.
